oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ||kabbo (Jantje) (II)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Women's hunting is called |kua. Women dig out things and 'hunt' prey such as 'Bushman rice'. They 'kill' the rice in its hole (here a figure of speech) because it runs about. Men's hunting is called !hunn. 1) This story is found in Book II-36.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On women's hunting or |kua
